meanings.sent1: The picture became blurrier as the fog rolled in.
meanings.sent2: The blurrier image made it hard to recognize the person in the photo.
meanings.sent3: The blurrier outline of the mountain looked like a giant sleeping under a blanket.
meanings.sent4: Her memory of the event was blurrier than a dream fading at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The blurrier details of the painting added a mysterious charm to the artwork.

meanings.definition: To make or become unclear or indistinct
meanings.sent1: The raindrops blurrier the ink on the paper.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the colors of the painting began to blurrier together.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to blurrier reality with illusion.
meanings.sent4: The tears in her eyes seemed to blurrier the world around her.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a soft brush to blurrier the edges of the portrait for a dreamy effect.

meanings.definition: More unclear or indistinct than something else
meanings.sent1: The second photo was blurrier than the first one.
meanings.sent2: His explanation only made things blurrier for the confused students.
meanings.sent3: The blurrier road sign led them on a wild goose chase.
meanings.sent4: The distant figure grew blurrier as the sun set behind it.
meanings.sent5: The blurrier lines in the drawing gave it a sense of movement and energy.
